intro: Chysis × chelsonii, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in its humid environment. The flowers are usually clustered in racemes and come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, and pink.
